summary: USDA's Conservation Reserve Program pays farmers to take agricultural lands out of use and devote them to conservation. This can include establishing grasses and trees that help prevent soil erosion and provide wildlife habitat. It also pays ranchers to preserve grasslands. In FY 2023, USDA paid $1.8 billion for 22.9 million acres. USDA could improve its methods for selecting land to boost program benefits and...
title: Conservation Reserve Program: Improving How USDA Selects Land Could Increase Environmental Benefits
